conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I'm here to help you reduce food waste.

• Refrigerate leftover dal in an airtight container. It will last for 3-4 days.

• You can also freeze it for longer storage, up to 2-3 months. Thaw it completely before reheating.

• Consider making dal paratha. Mix the leftover dal with wheat flour and spices to make a dough. Fry the parathas on a skillet. This can cost around 25 BDT.

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Refrigerate your dal immediately in a sealed container to extend its life.

Hello! I'm here to help you eat healthy on a budget.

• Focus on getting enough protein and iron.

• Consider lentils (dal) which cost around 60 BDT per kg, and spinach (palong shak) which costs around 20 BDT per bunch.

• Iron and protein are important for energy and overall health.

Next step: Try adding more lentils and spinach to your diet this week.

conversationHistory.userMessage: Can you help with meal planning?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I'm here to help you plan some affordable meals.

• Main meal: Chicken and vegetable curry with rice (approx. 80 BDT). This is a balanced meal with protein and essential nutrients.

• Cheaper alternative: Egg curry with rice (approx. 50 BDT). This is a good source of protein and is budget-friendly.

Next step: When buying vegetables, check local markets for the best deals.
